item.title: Convergence in statistics
item.description: 1. convergence in distribution 2. convergence in probability 3. convergence in \(L_{P}\) 4. convergence almost surely

item.title: Generalized Linear Model
item.description: In statistics, the generalized linear model (GLM) is a flexible generalization of ordinary linear regression that allows for response variables that have error distribution models other than a normal distribution. The GLM generalizes linear regression by allowing the linear model to be related to the response variable via a link function and by allowing the magnitude of the variance of each measurement to be a function of its predicted value.
